intro: Hieracium canalense, commonly known as the canal sandstem, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the dandelion family (Compositae) and is characterized by its yellow flowers and hairy stems. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils, often in coastal or inland areas with dry conditions. It has a taproot system and produces small, bract-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Hieracium canalense is an annual or biennial plant, depending on the climate, and is often found in disturbed habitats.
